<recipient first="Francis" last="Marion" type="individual"/>
<p>
HEAD-QUARTERS, <a href='/results.php?city=ashley hill' rel='city origin'>Ashley Hill</a>, <a rel="month origin" value="7">July</a> <a rel='day origin' value='24'>24</a>, <a href='/results.php?year=1782' rel="origin">1782</a>. 
</p><p>
SIR: 
</p><p>
I am directed by <a href='/results.php?tla=nag' rel='colleague met'>Major-General Greene</a> to request you will be 
pleased to furnish fifty men as an escort to some wagons with clothing, 
waiting at Laurens Ferry for the purpose. The General desires you 
will, as early as possible, furnish him with a return of the men you 
have, specifying the number, how they are armed, and how many days 
it will take you to join this army, after your receive this order. 
I am, with respect, your most obdt. humble servant, 
</p><p>
<a href="/results.php?tla=jbu" rel="me">J. BURNET</a>, Aide-de-Camp. 
</p>
</letter>
